# rooCookie
**Web**

### Description

Roo seems to have left his computer on, can you find his password?  
http://roocookie.chal.imaginaryctf.org

### Solution  
\<pic here\>
Insepct the source, we can easily find an encrypted token 
```html
<script>
function createToken(text) {
	let encrypted = "";
  for (let i = 0; i < text.length; i++) {
		encrypted += ((text[i].charCodeAt(0)-43+1337) >> 0).toString(2)
  }
  document.cookie = encrypted
}

document.cookie = ""
</script>
```
Every character is converted to ASCII, -43+1337, and turned into a binary. With some tests, we can find out every character is 11 bits. 

Not hard to get it decrypted:

```python
encrypted = ''

for i in range(int(len(encrypted)/11)):
    print(chr(int(encrypted[i*11:(i+1)*11], 2)-1337+43), end='')
```
There we get the result: 
```
username="roo" & password="ictf{h0p3_7ha7_wa5n7_t00_b4d}"
```
